hypothesis_content.title: Failed Breakout Fade in Low-Volume Neutral Market
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, a breakout attempt (price moving >1.5% outside the prior 5-day range) that occurs on below-average volume (<90% of 20-day avg volume) will fail and revert to the midpoint of the prior range within 36 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Breakouts on low volume lack conviction and are often traps set by market makers or larger players. In a neutral, range-bound market, these false breakouts are frequently faded, providing a high-probability mean reversion setup.
entry_conditions: BTC price moves >1.5% above the 5-day high or below the 5-day low
Volume on the breakout candle < 0.9 * 20-day average volume
Fade the breakout: SHORT if breakout above, LONG if breakout below

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to the midpoint of the prior 5-day range
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price extends a further 1% in the breakout direction beyond the initial breakout point

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of low-volume breakouts continue in the breakout direction for a further 1% instead of reverting.
